creator: demeester_roel@yahoo.com
text:
I have the following ftp script where all attribute values are parameters 
defined in an external .properties file. (The script is used by different people 
in team).
both server and remotedir attributes are expanded,
but this is not the case for the userid and password, the are not recognizedas 
ant-properties!

        <ftp server="${printer.hostname}"
             remotedir="${printer.ftp.dir}"
             userid="${printer.username}"
             password="${printer.password}">
            <fileset dir="${dist.dir}">
                <include name="${package.jar}"/>
            </fileset>
        </ftp>

creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com
text:
please direct this to the ant user mailing list
hint: try <echo>user name is ${printer.username}</echo>

I don't understand your tip.
I've done <echo>user name is ${printer.user}</echo> just before the <ftp> task 
and i definitely get the correct username.

I'll have a look in the user mailing lists.
creator: demeester_roel@yahoo.com

text:
I did not mean to be flippent (but I was... sorry).
The resolution of properties in attributes is not done by
the individual tasks, but is done by ant core code - so
this cannot be a problem with the ftp task.

Are you sure that you have set the "printer.username" property ?
your echo task uses "printer.user" for example
creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com
demeester_roel@yahoo.com
